question: Question_C_01
statement:
A mollusc grows inside a shell and produces new shell material at its
opening (indicated in the image below in bold)

(img)

The volume of the shell can be approximated as that of a cone of base
radius \emph{r} and height \emph{h}.

(img)

Given that the height of the cone grows at a constant rate of 0.1
cm/year, at what rate will the volume of the cone be changing when
\emph{h = 10} and \emph{r = 1} cm? Leave your answer in terms of $/pi$

Note that:

$V_{cone} = \frac13 \pi r^2 h$
